Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Okay let me start by breaking down what the user needs They want me to generate questions that clarify and improve understanding of the property onboarding process described The user mentioned targeting missing details decision criteria roles timing and exceptions Also no SQL or implementation stuff just conceptual

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: First I need to identify the main phases in the process initial contact documentation property manager assignment marketing tenant screening and quality checks Each phase has decision points and potential exceptions

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Maybe start with the documentation phase The interviewee mentioned missing or outdated docs Whats considered outdated How long is a document valid What happens if the landlord cant provide updated docs Are there common bottlenecks here Next assigning the property manager Factors like workload geographic specialization experience How is workload measured Is it just number of properties or also tenant issues What is the process when no manager fits all criteria Who makes the final call The meeting between manager and landlord what specific policies are discussed How are disagreements handled if landlord insists on something against company policy Are there standard templates for these discussions Scheduling photographer and inspector Who coordinates Whats the typical timeline What if the landlord is unresponsive How are repair costs negotiated Who approves Marketing phase How are pricing models updated Who decides on promotional discounts What if the property doesnt attract tenants quickly When is it considered activated in the portal Tenant screening What are the non negotiable criteria How are multiple applicants prioritized What if the best candidate has a pet but policy says no pets How are lease negotiations handled Quality checks Who reviews for compliance What happens if issues are found after activation How are custom lease clauses approved Whats the escalation path for exceptions Also timing overall whats the average timeline from contact to activation Which steps cause the most delays How is communication tracked across teams What tools are used for handoffs Need to ask about metrics How do they measure success What KPIs track onboarding efficiency Any common failure points Finally exceptions Special insurance cases custom clauses Whats the process for those Who has authority to approve deviations How are they documented
